channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wood and fluorescent strip lighting bulb dumped. Outside 20 Derwent grove, on pavement between tree and railings., 26th January
item.description:
Been there 2 weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Derwent Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Massively overgrown tree on Griggs place, off grange road., 26th January
item.description:
This tree needs to be radically pruned or even felled. It shrouds the street lamp, and it looks to be breaching the makeshift rear boundary fence to a property on grange walk and makes this street unsafe at night. Please action. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grigg's Place, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping o/s 141 Park Crescent junction Bexley Road, 26th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped a very large piece of hardboard/MDF and leant it up against a fence. It is obstructing the pavement and someone could trip over it. Please can this be removed with a matter of urgency .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Crescent, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping at St Vincent house - grange walk - AGAIN, 26th January
item.description:
Fly tipping again. Please develop a solution to this problem so it doesn’t keep re-occurring whether that’s CCTV even more signage warden visits or whatever. This is literally becoming a farce and it’s happening almost every day it seems. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fendall Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Graffiti on bike store on Tom Smith Close, 26th January
item.description:
There’s been graffiti on this bike store for at least 6 months. Great if someone could remove it. Thanks

item.title: Blocked gutter, 26th January
item.description:
Gas board dump spoils temporarily on the pavement/gutter/road, but the grab lorry which removes the spoils doesn't clear the gutter. Any heavy rain running down Tile Kiln Lane is blocked and will be deposited in the two house on the junction of aldwins Park and Tile Kiln Lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tile Kiln Lane, Coldblow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor quality pothole repair - grange road near junction with Tower Bridge road, 26th January
item.description:
There is recurrent potholes at this location, due to poor quality repairs which last 6-12 months only. This is a waste of tax payer money. Please ensure this work is done properly - it requires a section to be cut out and resurfaced rather than just infills that are compacted by traffic and which fail within the year. You can see from the photos the edges of the infills are not sealed. Inevitably, the undying problem gets bigger each time. Aim for “right first time”, please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brookmead Way Road sign cannot be seen, 26th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Bridge Road, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Potential Ash dieback, 26th January
item.description:
This looks like an Ash tree that could be suffering from dieback. It is located in Lesnes Abbey Woods, specifically the part that backs onto our garden in Woodland Way SE2 0QQ - Although we have only recently moved in we noticed crown death on the tree in question in September last year. Could a specialist come and assess it and carry out any required works to make it less dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Way, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
